sen.j: 慈延（じえん、寛延元年（1748年）- 文化 (元号)2年7月8日 (旧暦)（1805年8月2日））は、江戸時代中期から後期にかけての天台宗の僧・歌人。
sen.e: Jien (1748-August 2, 1805) was a priest of Tendai Sect and poet from the mid to the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: 「文化2年7月8日」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦1805年8月2日 」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: Jien (1748-August 2, 1805) was a priest of the Tendai sect and poet from the mid to late Edo Period.
sen.cmt: made "Sect" lower case and "Period" upper case;
sen.e: Jien (1748-August 2, 1805) was a priest of the Tendai sect and poet from the mid to late Edo Period.

sen.j: 父は儒医塚田旭嶺。儒学者塚田大峯の弟。
sen.e: His father was Confucian doctor Kyokurei TSUKADA.
His father was the Confucian doctor Kyohurei TSUKADA and he was a younger brother of the Confucian scholar Taiho TSUKADA.
sen.cmt: Combined this sentence with the one below to reduce sentence fragmentation
sen.e: His father was the Confucian doctor Kyohurei TSUKADA and he was a younger brother of the Confucian scholar Taiho TSUKADA.
His Azana (popular name) was Taigu and his Go (pen name) was Tokuzuan.
sen.cmt: Combined this sentence with the one below to reduce sentence fragmentation
sen.e: His Azana (popular name) was Taigu and his Go (pen name) was Tokuzuan.
He was originally from Shinano Province.
sen.cmt: Lengthened sentence a bit to reduce fragmentation
sen.e: He was originally from Shinano Province.

sen.j: 比叡山で出家して天台教学を学び、円教院に住した。
sen.e: He became a priest in Hiei-zan Mountain, learned about the Tendai Sect and lived in Enkyo-in Temple.
After becoming a priest at the temple in Mt. Hiei-zan, he learned about the Tendai sect and lived in the Enkyo-in Temple.
sen.cmt: added "temple in Mt. Hiei-zan" for clarity; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: After becoming a priest at the temple in Mt. Hiei, he learned about the Tendai sect and lived in the Enkyo-in Temple.
sen.cmt: Mt. Hiei-zan を Mt. Hiei に修正しました。

sen.j: 歌学を冷泉為村に学び、小沢蘆庵・澄月・伴蒿蹊とともに平安和歌四天王の一人に数えられた。
sen.e: He learned Kagaku (Uta Poem Study) from Tamemura REIZEI and was counted one of the Four best Waka poets of Heian period with Roan OZAWA, Chogetsu and Kokei BAN.
He learned Kagaku (Uta Poem Study) from Tamemura REIZEI and was counted as one of the four best Waka poets of the Heian period with Roan OZAWA, Chogetsu and Kokei BAN.
sen.cmt: made "Four" lower case; added "as" before "one of the four"
sen.e: He learned Kagaku (Uta Poem Study) from Tamemura REIZEI and was counted as one of the four best Waka poets of the Heian period with Roan OZAWA, Chogetsu and Kokei BAN.
